summary: This document is an email chain from February 2020 regarding a Criminal Division update report. It shows internal DOJ communications about deadlines for the report, with confusion over the due date (initially stated as August, then corrected to an imminent Friday).

persons.name: BWilliams8
persons.context: Appears as the email recipient in the header; likely a DOJ employee involved in the Criminal Division update process.

persons.name: Stephanie
persons.context: Mentioned as being out of the office; reports or updates are to be emailed to the sender instead.

events.title: Criminal Division update deadline
events.description: Email states the PC (likely 'Prosecution Criminal' or similar) update report is due.

events.title: Erroneous deadline mentioned
events.description: An earlier email incorrectly states the update is due on Friday, August 1+, causing confusion.

keyFacts: The email chain concerns a Criminal Division update report within the DOJ, with shifting deadlines.
There is internal confusion, with a deadline mistakenly set for August 2020 before being corrected to February 14, 2020.
Stephanie, a staff member, is noted as being out of the office, directing submissions to another recipient.
